### Matches per volume

```{python}
from IPython.display import Markdown
from tabulate import tabulate
import pandas as pd

number_of_rows = 50
path_mathes = "../data/data_matches.csv"
top_matches = pd.read_csv(path_mathes).sort_values(by='similarity_score',ascending=False)

matches_counts = top_matches.groupby(['volume_title']).count().reset_index()[['volume_title', 'phrase_woodruff']]
matches_counts
def create_markdown_table(path_mathes, condition, number_of_rows):
  data = top_matches.query(condition).reset_index(drop=True)
  markdown_table = Markdown(tabulate(
    data.head(number_of_rows),
    headers=list(data)
  ))
  return markdown_table

# match count/volume
Markdown(tabulate(
  matches_counts,
  headers=list(matches_counts)
))


```

### Old Testament

```{python}
create_markdown_table(path_mathes, 'volume_title == "Old Testament"', number_of_rows)

```

### New Testament

```{python}
create_markdown_table(path_mathes, 'volume_title == "New Testament"', number_of_rows)

```
